Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.data

Class PlayerData

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.data.PlayerData
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasicData, ChangeResData, DiscountData, ExtraDepData, ExtraProdData
public abstract class PlayerData
extends java.lang.Object
The type representing a player of the game, client side.

It is an abstract class used by almost every method that involves a player, client side. It is always related to an instantiable type of player through its originalData attribute. Every method, when called, calls the relative originalData's method which can be differently implemented based on the originalData's type.

    java.util.ArrayList<MappedResource> createMappedRes​(java.util.ArrayList<Resource> resources)
    When the player has to use some resources, these are received as parameter and, for each of them, the method search where the player has it, looking in all his deposits; finally he returns an ArrayList of MappedResource containing all the resources needed and their location so the player can choose which ones to use.

    • turnStateFilter

      public java.util.ArrayList<TurnState> turnStateFilter()

      Returns:
      an ArrayList of TurnState

    • setNickname

      public void setNickname​(java.lang.String newNickname)

    • slotCardsFilter

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> slotCardsFilter​(java.util.ArrayList<MappedResource> mapped)
      Called when the player wants to produce: it, based on player's resource and production powers, return all the production he can use to produce.

      It is called after every single production, because, for example, the player could use more then one production at the start of his turn but after using one of them he couldn't use any more production.

      Parameters:
      mapped - an ArrayList of MappedResource containing all player's resources and their position.
      Returns:
      the ArrayList of all the production's ID the player can use at the moment.

    • createMappedRes

      public java.util.ArrayList<MappedResource> createMappedRes​(java.util.ArrayList<Resource> resources)
      When the player has to use some resources, these are received as parameter and, for each of them, the method search where the player has it, looking in all his deposits; finally he returns an ArrayList of MappedResource containing all the resources needed and their location so the player can choose which ones to use.
      Parameters:
      resources - the resources needed to buy a development card or to produce.
      Returns:
      the ArrayList of MappedResources.

    • allResources

      public java.util.ArrayList<MappedResource> allResources()
      Gets all resources owned by the player specifying their location (using MappedResources), considering even the possible extra deposits.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of MappedResource

    • getCardFromID

      public ClientDevCard getCardFromID​(java.lang.String cardID)
      Gets a ClientDevCard having the cardID received as parameter. It searches in player's allGameCards attribute.
      Parameters:
      cardID - the ClientDevCard's ID.
      Returns:
      the ClientDevCard.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the ClientLeaderCard.

    • getMarket

      public Resource[][] getMarket()

    • handleWarehouse

      public java.util.ArrayList<MarketResource> handleWarehouse​(java.util.ArrayList<Resource> res)
      Called when the player takes resources from market.

      First of all the obtained resources are filtered by the Faith points and by the white marbles, if the player is a ChangeResData these ones are changed. Then asks to the player in which levels he wants to put every resource or even he wants to discard some of them, if there is no space the resource are automatically discarded. Finally returns an ArrayList containing the resources and their destination in the WareHouse, or in an extra deposit if the player is an ExtraDepData.

      Parameters:
      res - the resources gained from the market.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of MarketResources.

    • tableCardsFilter

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tableCardsFilter​(java.util.ArrayList<MappedResource> mapped)
      Called when the player wants to buy a development card: it, based on player's resource return all the development cards' ID he can buy. If the player is a DiscountData even the discount is considered.

      Parameters:
      mapped - all player's resources and their location
      Returns:
      all the development cards' ID the player can buy.

    • handleSlots

      public java.lang.Integer handleSlots​(java.lang.String devID)
      When player buys a ClientDevCard this method shows him all the slots in which he can put the just bought card; makes the player choose one of them and return it as Integer.
      Parameters:
      devID - the bought ClientDevCard's ID.
      Returns:
      the slot in which the player wants to put the card.

    • getDeposits

      public java.util.ArrayList<Resource[]> getDeposits()
      Gets all the deposits in which the player can puts resources takes from the market; if the player is an ExtraDepData considers even the extra deposits.
      Returns:
      all the players' deposits.

    • switchLevels

      public int switchLevels​(int origin)
      Used when the player wants to sort resources in his warehouse. It received the origin level from where the player wants to start to move resources, shows to the player all the possible deposits in which can move those resources and make him choose one of them. Finally return the number of the chosen level. If the player is an ExtraDepData even the extra deposits are consider.
      Parameters:
      origin - the level from where the player wants to move resources.
      Returns:
      the chosen level by the player to where puts the resources.

    • leaderCardsFilter

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> leaderCardsFilter()
      Gets, among the leader cards owned by the player, those ones that can be played at the moment.
      Returns:
      the array list with all playable leader cards' ID.

    • newTurn

      public void newTurn()
      Once it's player's turn, it clear the TurnState's list, so the player can start a new turn.

    • sendRequest

      public void sendRequest​(Request request)
      Once the player made all the choices, this method receive the Request relative to the action and sends it to the server.
      Parameters:
      request - the Request.

    • changeEmpty

      public java.util.ArrayList<Resource> changeEmpty​(java.util.ArrayList<Resource> res)
      If the player is an ChangeResData, changes all the empty resource in the ArrayList received as parameter, if not returns the same resources received as parameters.
      Parameters:
      res - the resource to change, or not.
      Returns:
      the possibly changed resource.
